Pegawai Microsoft Kerja 4 Hari Seminggu, Hasilnya Mengejutkan
05 Nov 2019, 17:00 by Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


Kantor Microsoft. Foto: detikINET/Rachmatunnisa

Tokyo - Beberapa perusahaan mulai mengadopsi waktu kerja lebih pendek, yakni 4 hari dalam seminggu. Microsoft mencoba ikut serta dan hasilnya mengejutkan.Raksasa software itu menjajalnya di Jepang pada Agustus silam di mana kantor sudah tutup pada hari Jumat. Karyawan jadi punya waktu libur lebih panjang.Hasilnya menjanjikan. Meski jumlah waktu kerja banyak terpangkas, produktivitas naik 40% dibandingkan periode yang sama tahun sebelumnya. Selain hari kerja, waktu meeting juga dipotong tidak boleh lebih dari setengah jam. Pegawai didorong untuk berdiskusi di layanan messaging.Dikutip detikINET dari CNN, dengan tutup lebih awal, maka perusahaan juga bisa menghemat sumber daya seperti listrik dan kertas. Dari survei yang digelar, 92% karyawan Microsoft senang dengan program ini."Bekerja di waktu yang pendek, istirahat yang baik dan banyak belajar. Saya ingin karyawan berpikir dan mengalami bagaimana mencapai hasil yang sama dengan waktu kerja 20% lebih rendah," sebut presiden Microsoft Jepang, Takuya Hirano.Microsoft pun ingin menggelar program lanjutan. Selain itu, mereka berencana pula memberikan subisidi sampai USD 920 jika karyawan dan keluarga ingin liburan.Di Jepang, karyawan biasa bekerja begitu panjang, bahkan ada beberapa kasus bunuh diri karenanya. Perusahaan dan pemerintah Jepang pun mencoba mencari solusinya, misalnya pegawai diminta pulang lebih cepat pada hari Jumat. Microsoft employees work 4 days a week, the results are shocking
05 Nov 2019, 17:00 by Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


Microsoft Office. Photo: detikINET / Rachmatunnisa

Tokyo - Some companies are starting to adopt shorter work hours, which is 4 days a week. Microsoft tried to participate and the results were surprising. The software giant tested it in Japan last August where the office was closed on Friday. Employees have longer vacation days. The results are promising. Even though the amount of work time was cut a lot, productivity rose 40% compared to the same period the previous year. In addition to workdays, the meeting time must also be cut not more than half an hour. Employees are encouraged to discuss in the messaging service. Quoted from CNN, by closing early, the company can also save resources such as electricity and paper. From the survey that was held, 92% of Microsoft employees were happy with this program. "Working in a short time, good rest and a lot of learning. I want employees to think and experience how to achieve the same results with working time 20% lower," said the president Microsoft Japan, Takuya Hirano.Microsoft also wants to hold an advanced program. In addition, they also plan to provide subsidies of up to USD 920 if employees and families want a vacation. In Japan, ordinary employees work so long, there are even some suicides because of it. Companies and the Japanese government are also trying to find a solution, for example employees are asked to leave early on Friday.
